author: Staff Reporter
text:
Tamil Nadu Sand Lorry Owners Federation (TNSLOF) has urged the State Government to cancel the license given to stock yard sales and wanted the Public Works Department to directly sell sand to lorry owners so that overloading and corruption be prevented.

Irregularities

Addressing the media after the general body meeting here on Thursday, federation president Sella Rasamani said that irregularities in sand mining happen only because it was run by private parties through licensing.

“The Public Works Department should receive the demand draft from the lorry owners and supply the sand,” he added. Also, there was a revenue loss of over Rs. 1,000 crore to the government every year by the functioning of stock yard where second sales happen.

“The government should cancel the license for stock yard,” he added. Mr. Rasamani urged the State Government to establish weigh bridge in all sand mining areas so that overloading and damage to road were prevented.

He also wanted holiday for mining activities on Sundays so that drivers take rest, to prevent accidents.

“Due to stress, accidents happen. Hence, sand sales in river beds should be stopped on Sundays,” he added.

Licence

The president also wanted relaxation in the eligibility norm of Class 8 pass for obtaining licence for heavy vehicles as acute shortage of drivers prevailed in the State. “Certificates issued by the training institute should be accepted and the State Government should take up the issue with the Centre,” he added.
title: Stop sale of sand at stock yard: lorry owners
